title: British Fantasy Feature â€˜The Realm of Eldervinâ€™ Lands Black Mandala Deal (EXCLUSIVE)
description:
Black Mandala has picked up international sales rights to â€œThe Realm of Eldervin,â€ a British fantasy feature from filmmaker Oliver Hollingdale.

	Th
body:
Black Mandala has picked up international sales rights to â€œThe Realm of Eldervin,â€ a British fantasy feature from filmmaker Oliver Hollingdale.

	The film centers on Jonas, a troubled practitioner of magic who assembles a group of companions â€“ including rogue Dagon, elf Nimue and assassin Solomon â€“ to investigate a mysterious corruption spreading through a quiet village in the mystical Realm of Eldervin. As they journey through haunted woodlands and forgotten ruins, the group discovers the darkness may be connected to their own pasts.
	

	The cast includes Craig Standen, Tess Dimos, Lewis Sycamore and Martin Portlock, who recently gained attention through his appearance as â€œThe Witchâ€ on â€œBritainâ€™s Got Talentâ€ and his role as Peter Pan in â€œNeverland Nightmareâ€ as part of â€œThe Twisted Childhood Universe.â€ Jason Flemyng, known for his work in â€œLock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels,â€ â€œSnatch,â€ â€œX-Men: First Class,â€ â€œThe Curious Case of Benjamin Buttonâ€ and â€œKick-Ass,â€ provides voiceover narration.


	â€œOur movie, at its core, is a grounded approach to fantasy, built on atmosphere, character, and emotional truth rather than relying on large-scale spectacle,â€ Hollingdale said. â€œIâ€™ve always been drawn to stories where magic is ancient, intimate, and woven into the fabric of nature.â€

	The director cited â€œThe Lord of the Rings,â€ â€œThe Green Knightâ€ and â€œThe Fountainâ€ as influences, noting the film blends mythic storytelling with emotional resonance.

	â€œThe landscape of Eldervin is as much a character as any of the heroes,â€ Hollingdale added. â€œWe embraced natural light, handcrafted textures, and moments of quiet surrealism to give the world a poetic, lived-in quality.â€
	

	The production features costume work by Norse Dragon Armoury, an original score by composer Siddhartha Barnhoorn and cinematography by Morgan Andrews. Palm Haven Studios and Morgan Films supported the production.

	Auckland-based Black Mandala, founded by Michael Kraetzer and Nicolas Onetti in 2017, handles more than 150 titles and specializes in independent horror and genre distribution.

schema.headline: British Fantasy Feature â€˜The Realm of Eldervinâ€™ Lands Black Mandala Deal (EXCLUSIVE)

title: HBO Max Rolls Out in 8 European Territories, Announces New Prime Video Bundling Deal
description: As HBO Max goes live today in eight new European countries â€” including Germany, Italy and Austria â€” the streamer has announced a new bundling deal w
body:
As HBO Max goes live today in eight new European countries â€” including Germany, Italy and Austria â€” the streamer has announced a new bundling deal with Prime Video in those territories that extends their existing partnership in France, Spain, Sweden, Belgium and the Netherlands.Â 

	The global streaming serviceÂ from Warner Bros. Discovery that operates in more than 100 countries has just added Italy,Â Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Luxembourg,Â Liechtenstein,Â IsraelÂ andÂ Greece to its footprint as it moves closer toÂ being available across all of Europe, with the U.K. and Ireland launching at the end of March.Â 
	

	Following its announcement last week of a distribution deal with Germanâ€™s RTL, HBO Max has now revealed that in Germany, besides Prime Video and RTL+, the service will be available on Waipu.tv. They have also struck deals in Switzerland deals with Sunrise and Swisscom. In Italy, customers of Telecom Italiaâ€™s TIM platform with also have HBO Max access.


	As previously announced, for the first time, viewers in these territories will be able to enjoy content from HBO, Warner Bros. Pictures, Warner Bros. Television, the DC Universe and Max Originals all in one place. Some of the streamerâ€™s most popular shows include â€œThe Pitt,â€ â€œIt: Welcome to Derry,â€ â€œHouse of the Dragon,â€ â€œThe Last of Us,â€ â€œThe White Lotusâ€ and â€œEuphoria,â€ while movie offerings include â€œSuperman,â€ â€œThe Batman,â€ â€œDuneâ€ and the â€œHarry Potterâ€ franchise. The news also comes in time for the Olympic Winter Games Milano Cortina 2026, which will broadcast live on HBO Max from Feb. 6 to 22.
	

	â€œItÂ is excitingÂ to kick off the new year by expanding intoÂ some of the biggest economies inÂ theÂ world, as weÂ continue toÂ deliverÂ HBO MaxÂ to newÂ viewers,â€ said JB Perrette, CEO and president of global streaming and games at Warner Bros. Discovery. â€œNext up isÂ theÂ launch of HBO Max in theÂ U.K.Â and IrelandÂ in late March, which will complete HBO Maxâ€™s rollout across Europe.â€

	HBO Max, which first launched first in the U.S. in 2020, has since expanded across Latin America, Europe and Asia. For Q3 2025, Warner Bros. Discovery reported 128 millionÂ globalÂ streaming subscribers.Â 

	The bombshell news ofÂ Netflixâ€™s acquisition of Warner Bros. DiscoveryÂ has cast some doubt over the future of HBO Max, but the streamerÂ is forging ahead with its European expansion.

schema.headline: HBO Max Rolls Out in 8 European Territories, Announces New Prime Video Bundling Deal

title: BBC to File Motion Seeking Dismissal of Trumpâ€™s $10 Billion Defamation Suit Over â€˜Panoramaâ€™ Edit
description: The BBC will file a motion to dismiss President Donald Trumpâ€˜s $10 billion defamation lawsuit, challenging the case on jurisdictional grounds and di
body:
The BBC will file a motion to dismiss President Donald Trumpâ€˜s $10 billion defamation lawsuit, challenging the case on jurisdictional grounds and disputing claims the broadcaster acted with malice, according to court papers filed Monday and reported by BBC News.

	The legal battle stems from fallout over a â€œPanoramaâ€ documentaryâ€™s controversial editing of Trumpâ€™s January 6, 2021 speech â€“ an issue that contributed to the November resignations of BBC directorâ€“general Tim Davie and head of news Deborah Turness after an internal memo criticizing the edit leaked publicly.
	

	Trump filed the lawsuit in a Florida court last month, alleging defamation and trade practices violations. The BBCâ€™s planned defense will argue the Florida court lacks proper jurisdiction over the British broadcaster and that Trump has failed to demonstrate a valid legal claim, court documents cited by BBC News show.


	Central to the BBCâ€™s defense strategy is the argument that Trump cannot prove actual damages from the program, which aired before he won re-election and carried Florida by a commanding margin. The broadcaster will also maintain Trump cannot establish the documentary was produced with â€œactual maliceâ€ â€“ a critical threshold in U.S. defamation law.

	The corporation disputes Trumpâ€™s claim that the documentary was available on BritBox and emphasizes the program never aired in the U.S. The BBC will note the disputed footage comprises approximately 15 seconds of an hour-long documentary that extensively featured Trump supporters and provided balanced campaign coverage.

	The controversy centers on how â€œPanoramaâ€ condensed Trumpâ€™s speech before the U.S. Capitol riot. Trump originally told the crowd: â€œWeâ€™re going to walk down to the Capitol, and weâ€™re going to cheer on our brave senators and congressmen and women.â€ More than 50 minutes later in the address, he said: â€œAnd we fight. We fight like hell.â€
	

	The documentary edited these segments together, showing Trump saying: â€œWeâ€™re going to walk down to the Capitolâ€¦ and Iâ€™ll be there with you. And we fight. We fight like hell.â€

	While the BBC has apologized for the edit and acknowledged it created â€œthe mistaken impressionâ€ that Trump had â€œmade a direct call for violent action,â€ the broadcaster rejected Trumpâ€™s compensation demands and maintains there is no basis for a defamation claim.

	The BBC will also ask the court to pause pre-trial evidence exchange procedures until a ruling on the dismissal motion is issued.

	If the case proceeds, a trial date in 2027 has been proposed. The BBC previously indicated in December it would defend against the lawsuit.

	A BBC spokesperson told Variety: â€œAs we have made clear previously, we will be defending this case. We are not going to make further comment on ongoing legal proceedings.â€

schema.headline: BBC to File Motion Seeking Dismissal of Trumpâ€™s $10 Billion Defamation Suit Over â€˜Panoramaâ€™ Edit

title: HBO Max Drops Trailer for First Italian Original, Marco Bellocchioâ€™s â€˜Portobello,â€™ as It Launches in Italy and Other Key European Markets (EXCLUSIVE)
description: HBO Max launches today in Italy with several Italian originals to follow soon, the standout one being Marco Bellocchioâ€™s limited series â€œPortobelloâ€
body:
HBO Max launches today in Italy with several Italian originals to follow soon, the standout one being Marco Bellocchioâ€™s limited series â€œPortobelloâ€ that reconstructs one of the countryâ€™s most clamorousÂ travestiesÂ of justice.

	The HBO Max streaming service is also launching today, Jan. 13, in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Luxembourg and Liechtenstein.

	â€œPortobelloâ€ â€“ to which Variety has been given exclusive trailer access â€“ is the true story of popular Italian TV host Enzo Tortora who, among other programs, conducted a primetime game show by the same title that aired on Italian state broadcaster RAI for seven seasons starting in 1977. The six-episodeÂ  show is a vivid account of how Tortora, in 1985, went from being a top-rated TV star to being wrongly convicted of conspiring with the Neapolitan crime syndicate known as Camorra.
	

	Tortora is played by frequent Bellocchio collaborator Fabrizio Gifuni who starred as former Italian Prime Minister Aldo Moro in Bellocchioâ€™s previous limited TV series â€œExterior Night,â€ about the 1978 kidnapping and assassination of the countryâ€™s leader by Red Brigades terrorists.Â 


	â€œPortobello,â€ which premiered last September to positive reviews at the Venice Film Festival and travelled to Toronto and Busan, will be the first HBO Original Italian production to launch on the HBO Max streaming platform in Italy on Feb. 20. Â 

	The series is produced by Mediawan-owned Our Films and Kavav Film, in co-production withArte France and in collaboration with RAI Fiction and The Apartment Pictures, a Fremantle company.It is produced by Lorenzo Mieli and Mario Gianani for Our Films, and by Simone Gattoni for Kavac Film.
	

	Bellocchioâ€™s series is expected to be available in coming months on HBO Max globally, including the U.S., U.K., Latin America and Europe, excluding France and Germany.

	Other standout HBO Max Italian originals in the pipeline include â€œIn Uteroâ€ a series set in a Barcelona fertility clinic starring Sergio Castellitto (â€œConclaveâ€), directed by Maria Sole Tognazzi (â€œPetraâ€), and produced by ITV-owned Cattleya in association with Paramount Television International Studio. The lineup also includes previously announced docuseries â€œGina Lollobrigida: Diva Contesa,â€ exposing the battle over the legacy of the cinema icon, and â€œSaman,â€ depicting the struggle of a young Pakistani woman who was murdered by her own family in Northern Italia for refusing an arranged marriage.

	Watch the â€œPortobelloâ€ trailer here:

schema.headline: HBO Max Drops Trailer for First Italian Original, Marco Bellocchioâ€™s â€˜Portobello,â€™ as It Launches in Italy and Other Key European Markets (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Inside the Ballroom at the Golden Globes: 12 Starry Moments You Didnâ€™t See on TV
description:
You may be a global comedy superstar, but that doesnâ€™t get you out of spousal support duties at the Golden Globe Awards.

	Kevin Hart exited the Bev
body:
You may be a global comedy superstar, but that doesnâ€™t get you out of spousal support duties at the Golden Globe Awards.

	Kevin Hart exited the Beverly Hiltonâ€™s International Ballroom on Sunday night at the end of a long Golden Globe Awards ceremony holding up the long train of the beautiful beaded frock worn by his wife, Eniko Hart. Kevin Hart was a good sport about the whole thing, just as he was about the number of jokes and comments that came his way during the three hour and 15-minute ceremony.
	

	With so many stars packed into a small space â€” enhanced with sushi and Champagne â€” the star-gazing is a huge part of the fun of going to the Globes IRL.


	Hereâ€™s a rundown of some things that you couldnâ€™t see on TV:

	Power table: Keri Russell, Matthew Rhys, Claire Danes and â€œThe Beast in Meâ€ writer Daniel Pearle seemed to have a heck of a time at their table. Russell was animated in waving at friends and fans throughout the ceremony. Brett Goldstein, who sat at a neighboring table, had a chat with Rhys. Emma Stone also stopped by to talk with Russell. So did Jacob Elordi.

	HBO Maxâ€™s Sarah Aubrey and â€œThe Pittâ€ executive producers John Wells and R. Scott Gemmill sat together with â€œHacksâ€ creators Lucia Aniello, Paul W. Downs and Jen Statsky. Aubrey and Wells celebrated with a first bump when â€œThe Pittâ€ star Noah Wyle won for actor in a TV drama. The â€œHacksâ€ trio shot to their feet with applause and cheers when Jean Smart won for TV comedy actress. Wells and Gemmill later squeezed their way through the tables to collect their trophy for best drama series.
	

	Teyana Taylor demonstrated her roots as a choreographer by dancing all the way down the wings as the â€œOne Battle After Anotherâ€ star left the stage after winning the first trophy of the night, for film supporting actress in a comedy.

	Presenters pass the time: Queen Latifah bopped to Chicâ€™s â€œGood Timesâ€ as she waited to hand out a trophy. Colman Domingo did the same to Kool and the Gangâ€™s â€œHollywood Swingingâ€ as he waited for his presenter slot. Ayo Edebiri turned to someone in the crowd and made a heart sign with both hands as she waited for her moment alongside a very pregnant Hailee Steinfeld.

	Bill Maher and Mel Robbins exchanged greetings during a commercial break. Same for Judd Apatow and Brett Goldstein.

	Another power table: Sarah Snook and Elle Fanning sat with NBCUniversalâ€™s Pearlena Igbokwe. That group rose up in applause when Amy Poehler won for best podcast.

	â€œThe White Lotusâ€ creator Mike White stood for Erin Dohertyâ€™s win for â€œAdolescence.â€

	Adam Sandler and Dwayne Johnson stood to clap for Wagner Mouraâ€™s win for â€œThe Secret Agent.â€

	Ted Sarandos, Nicole Avant and Guillermo del Toro stood up as the â€œKpop Demon Huntersâ€ stars claimed the original song prize for â€œGoldenâ€ and for animated film.

	Nikki Glaserâ€™s opening monologue played really well in the ballroom. It wasnâ€™t tame, but it wasnâ€™t vicious. She threaded the needle perfectly to get the crowd on her side.

	By contrast, the one bit that went over like a lead balloon with the industry crowd was the moment when two UFC fighters briefly took the stage, followed by the wink-wink-nudge-nudge presenter banter between â€œHeated Rivalryâ€ stars Connor Storrie and Hudson Williams. You canâ€™t win â€˜em all.

	(Pictured: Jacob Elordi and Teyana Taylor)

schema.headline: Inside the Ballroom at the Golden Globes: 12 Starry Moments You Didnâ€™t See on TV

title: NBC Pulls â€˜Law & Order: SVUâ€™ Episode Featuring Timothy Busfield Following Child Sex Abuse Charges
description:
NBC will no longer air an upcoming episode of â€œLaw & Order: SVUâ€ in which Timothy Busfield appears in a guest star role. 

	Variety has confirmed th
body:
NBC will no longer air an upcoming episode of â€œLaw & Order: SVUâ€ in which Timothy Busfield appears in a guest star role. 

	Variety has confirmed that the broadcast network has shelved the episode, which was set to air on Jan. 15. Instead, NBC will air the â€œSVUâ€ episode originally scheduled to air on Jan. 22. Busfield was set to play a judge in the now pulled â€œSVUâ€ episode, which is titled â€œCorrosive.â€ He previously guest starred on the long-running series in 2011 and directed two other episodes in 2019.
	

	It was recently reported that an arrest warrant was issued for Busfield in New Mexico on charges of sexual abuse involving a minor. The accusations stem from his time as director on the Fox drama series â€œThe Cleaning Lady.â€ One of a pair of twin boys who worked on the show claims that Busfield touched his â€œprivate areasâ€ when he was seven years old, and again when he was eight, while they were on set. 


	Warner Bros. Television, which produced â€œThe Cleaning Lady,â€ had conducted an internal investigation into Busfieldâ€™s behavior towards the boys onset in 2025 following an anonymous tip involving a separate incident. The studio previously issued a statement regarding the accusations stating: 

	â€œThe health and safety of our cast and crew is always our top priority, especially the safety of minors on our productions. We take all allegations of misconduct very seriously and have systems in place to promptly and thoroughly investigate, and when needed, take appropriate action. We are aware of the current charges against Mr. Busfield and have been and will continue to cooperate with law enforcement.â€

schema.headline: NBC Pulls â€˜Law & Order: SVUâ€™ Episode Featuring Timothy Busfield Following Child Sex Abuse Charges

title: Philippine Theater Star Lhorvie Nuevo-Tadioan Lands Title Role in Sonny Calventoâ€™s â€˜Mother Maybeâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Philippine theater actor Lhorvie Nuevo-Tadioan has secured the title role in director Sonny Calventoâ€˜s â€œMother Maybe,â€ joining previously announced
body:
Philippine theater actor Lhorvie Nuevo-Tadioan has secured the title role in director Sonny Calventoâ€˜s â€œMother Maybe,â€ joining previously announced star Anthony Jennings, Southern Lantern Studios revealed.

	The horror-comedy-drama, a tri-national co-production between Southern Lantern Studios (Philippines), E&W Films (Singapore) and Volos Films Ltd. (Taiwan), follows Marco (Jennings), a young man who reunites with his long-lost mother during a high-stakes Asian game show, only to discover she transforms into something monstrous at night. Nuevo-Tadioan will play Minda, the mother at the center of the supernatural narrative.
	

	In the role, Nuevo-Tadioan portrays a parent who communicates minimally and keeps much of her emotional life hidden. The character required a performer who can build tension through what goes unexpressed â€“ through hidden truths, contained feelings and deliberate physical choices. The film uses supernatural horror to examine the overseas Filipino worker experience and the emotional toll of migration. 


	The casting represents just Nuevo-Tadioanâ€™s second film project â€“  after her screen debut in â€œPhantosmia,â€ a film by director Lav Diaz that premiered at the Venice Film Festival â€“ though she brings extensive stage credentials to the production. A veteran member of Tanghalang Pilipino â€“ the Cultural Center of the Philippinesâ€™ resident theater company â€“ Nuevo-Tadioan has built a reputation for performances requiring both emotional depth and physical discipline.

	Her work in â€œAnak Datuâ€ brought her dual honors: the Gawad Buhay Award for Outstanding Performer and the Aliw Award for Best Featured Performer. Playing the character Potri Loling without any spoken lines, Nuevo-Tadioan demonstrated an ability to convey complex emotional states through physical performance alone.
	

	That particular skill caught Calventoâ€™s attention. â€œIn theater, Lhorvie carries an extraordinary authority,â€ Calvento said. â€œWhat moved me most was her ability to hold an audience even in silence. She doesnâ€™t need dialogue to be felt â€“ her body and stillness already speak.â€

	The director also praised Nuevo-Tadioanâ€™s natural screen presence. â€œThereâ€™s something deeply cinematic about her,â€ he added. â€œThe smallest shift in her movement, the way she holds a pause. Those nuances already tell a story. Thatâ€™s essential for this role.â€

	Calvento believes Nuevo-Tadioanâ€™s stage training has prepared her to maintain the roleâ€™s understated intensity and emotional complexity.

	Production on the film resumes in February. The project has secured significant industry recognition, winning the TAICCA Development Grant at Full Circle Lab Philippines and the Malaysian Development Lab for Feature Films in 2022, followed by the TAICCA x CNC Award for Best Project and the MPA Grand Award at the Taiwan Creative Content Fest in 2023.

schema.headline: Philippine Theater Star Lhorvie Nuevo-Tadioan Lands Title Role in Sonny Calventoâ€™s â€˜Mother Maybeâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Dinner at Nomaâ€™s Los Angeles Residency Will Cost $1500
description: Fans of chef RenÃ© Redzepi and his groundbreaking Noma restaurant can start getting in line on Monday, Jan. 26 for the Los Angeles residency this spr
body:
Fans of chef RenÃ© Redzepi and his groundbreaking Noma restaurant can start getting in line on Monday, Jan. 26 for the Los Angeles residency this spring. Well, not literally in line, since the Noma will pop-up at what is reportedly a historic venue in a Silver Lake residential neighborhood where the address wonâ€™t be revealed until reservations are made. 

	Aspiring diners can sign up for Nomaâ€™s newsletter by Jan. 23 to have a chance at reservations that will be released starting Jan. 26 â€” as long as they agree to a crew filming on the premises during service for a future documentary project. If a reservation is granted, the $1500 per person is due immediately â€” though it will include beverage pairing, tax and tip.
	

	Founded in Copenhagen in 2003, Noma has been named the worldâ€™s No. 1 restaurant four times and its elaborate tasting menus emphasize foraging, fermentation and local ingredients in conversation with Redzepiâ€™s Nordic roots.


	Redzepi is going to great lengths to establish the L.A. outpost from March 11 to June 26. After previous residencies in cities including Tokyo, Kyoto and Tulum, Mexico, the L.A. location will be the first longer-term project in the U.S. outside of a four-day stint in Brooklyn in 2022. Also planned for somewhere in Silver Lake is a Noma Projects shop where housemade items such as vinegar, garum and coffee will be for sale. 

	Redzepi explained in a statement how he chose the location. â€œIt had to be Los Angeles,â€ he wrote. â€œI love this region. The vast Pacific. The farmersâ€™ markets overflowing with produce in the middle of January. A place where you can have tacos for breakfast and a Thai tasting menu in an alleyway for dinner. Oaxacan mole from a strip mall. A great-grandmotherâ€™s kimchi soup served at 2 a.m. in Koreatown.
	

	â€œL.A. is a city of wild contrasts â€” a place that makes you ask: how can these things go together?â€



	

					Redzepi is considering using California-sourced ingredients including cactus, crab, citrus and flowers.
									Audrey Ma
	



	â€œFor this residency, our work will be shaped by the landscapes surrounding the city â€” from the Pacific to the mountains and deserts beyond â€” and by the people who know them best,â€ the Noma team added in a statement. â€œWeâ€™ve spent the past few months listening, learning, and building a new pantry of flavors rooted in this place, filtered through our imagination and the experience we bring with us from Copenhagen. We canâ€™t wait to share this work over the next coming months.â€

	In addition to collaborations with other L.A. restaurants, Redzepi will bring other chefs from Copenhagen for pop-ups, and his MAD non-profit will host talks like the October event that included director Lulu Wang.

	Redzepi is bringing numerous kitchen staffers, their families and children to L.A., which explains part of the high cost of the meal. The restaurant will also provide work experience and mentorships to students from underserved communities.

schema.headline: Dinner at Nomaâ€™s Los Angeles Residency Will Cost $1500

title: Elliot Page and Naomi Watts Star in New ACLU Campaign Supporting Trans Youth (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Elliot Page and Naomi Watts are among the bold-faced names starring in a new American Civil Liberties Union public awareness campaign in support of
body:
Elliot Page and Naomi Watts are among the bold-faced names starring in a new American Civil Liberties Union public awareness campaign in support of transgender youth.

	Launching Monday ahead of oral arguments at the U.S. Supreme Court in West Virginia v. BPJ Little v. Hecox â€” two cases challenging state laws that ban transgender girls from participating in school sports â€” â€œMore Than a Gameâ€ also features Megan Rapinoe, Sue Bird, Benito Skinner, Brianna Turner, Naomi Watts and a group of young people, including the lead plaintiff in one of the cases.
	

	The campaign includes photos and videos of participants wearing exclusive merchandise designed by award-winning fashion designer and ACLU artist ambassador Willy Chavarria. The photos were captured by artist and fashion photographer Collier Schorr and videography captured by Sundance award-winning writer and director Alessandra Lacorazza.


	â€œThis week the Supreme Court is set to consider a case that will have major implications for womenâ€™s sports, civil rights and the future of our country,â€ said U.S. Womenâ€™s National Team legend and two-time World Cup winner Rapinoe. â€œI am not going to be tricked into sacrificing hard fought civil rights protections because of anti-trans rhetoric. All women will be harmed if the Court rules against the young trans people at the center of these cases and I wanted to make unambiguously clear that I am on the side of equality and justice.â€

	The â€œMore Than a Gameâ€ campaignâ€™s first ad buys are during the Unrivaled womenâ€™s basketball series on Jan. 12 and will continue through in-person activations at Unrivaled playoff games in Miami in early March, featuring a 30-second ad with athletes, celebrities, artists, advocates and youth, both cisgender and transgender.
	

	â€œSupporting trans youth isnâ€™t just about sports,â€ Skinner says in the 30-second video spot, before Watts says: â€œItâ€™s about freedom.â€



	

	



	â€œThis moment in our countryâ€™s history is a test of our willingness to stand up and speak out for the most vulnerable,â€ said the ACLUâ€™s LGBT & HIV Project co-director Chase Strangio. â€œAnd while we will absolutely defend our rights and our humanity in the courts, we know that transgender peopleâ€™s path out of this moment of crisis will also require a broad, diverse coalition leading change in our communities and our culture. More Than A Game is our rejection of the efforts to divide us against one another and is instead a call for the unity we need to defend the freedom we deserve on and off the field.â€

	Page disclosed in a social media post five years ago that he was transgender. â€œI love that I am trans. And I love that I am queer,â€ he wrote.

	Wattsâ€™ daughter with ex-husband Liev Schreiber, Kai, is trans. Kai, 17, is a model who has worked with Valentino and Jason Wu. In May, she and her father and his wife Taylor attended Ali Forney Centerâ€™s A Place at the Table Gala in New York City. The center, which provides housing and support for homeless LGBTQ youth, currently serves more than 2,200 young people through its 24/7 Drop-In Center and network of 13 emergency and transitional housing sites.

	To learn more about the ACLU campaign, go to aclu.org.

schema.headline: Elliot Page and Naomi Watts Star in New ACLU Campaign Supporting Trans Youth (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Jon Stewart Exclaims â€˜What the Fâ€” Is Happening in This Country?â€™: â€˜From Minnesota, to Venezuela, to Iranâ€™
description: On this weekâ€™s episode of â€œThe Daily Show,â€ Jon Stewart covered the whirlwind of stories from over the weekend, which included Donald Trumpâ€™s handli
body:
On this weekâ€™s episode of â€œThe Daily Show,â€ Jon Stewart covered the whirlwind of stories from over the weekend, which included Donald Trumpâ€™s handling of Venezuela after the capture of NicolÃ¡s Maduro, proposed U.S. millitary action in Cuba, Greenland and Iran, as well as backlash from the shooting death of Renee Good, a 37 year old American citizen who was shot and killed by an ICE agent in Minnesota.

	â€œHow was your weekend? Was it good?â€ Stewart said at the top of Mondayâ€™s show. â€œHow was your weekend? Yeah. What the fuck is happening? What the fuck is happening in this country? From Minnesota, to Venezuela, to Iran, to Greenland, Cuba, Mexico, Colombia.â€
	

	Stewart went on to say that with all the chaos happening in the U.S., it feels like America is on the â€œDonald Trump gravitron,â€ adding, â€œWe donâ€™t know what up or down is. We just know it feels like we are all going to vomit.â€


	The late-night pundit deemed Trump â€œthe catalyst of all this chaos and confusion,â€ and slammed the president for â€œTGIFingâ€ it while the rest of the world scrambles for stability.

	â€œMeanwhile, our state department says, â€˜If youâ€™re an American, there are armed gangs [in Venezuela] trying to kill you,â€™â€ Stewart said. â€œSo you would think that maybe this calls for a little gathering in the situation tent or wherever is operationally right for talking about Venezuela right now. But the president had a different idea.â€

	Stewart then cut to a clip from ABC News, reporting that over the weekend, Trump gathered â€œtop oil executives at the White House to talk about divvying up Venezuelaâ€™s oil.â€
	

	â€œWhat the fuck is happening?â€ the late-night pundit exclaimed. â€œBy the way, lest you worry that Donald Trump is in any way feeling the burden of this moment, the terrifying responsibility of so many lives held in his hands. Let me reassure you, heâ€™s fine.â€

	The show then cut to a clip from the meeting, in which Trump interrupts the sit-down to look out the window and admire the construction of his new ballroom.

	â€œAnd look at Rubio and Vance,â€ Stewart joked. â€œLook at the faces on Heckle and Jeckle over here. Looking like, â€˜Oh! Pawpaw! He is so cute! You should see him when the ice cream truck goes by!â€™â€

	Watch the entire monologue below.

schema.headline: Jon Stewart Exclaims â€˜What the Fâ€” Is Happening in This Country?â€™: â€˜From Minnesota, to Venezuela, to Iranâ€™

title: Chix On Netflix! Can You Guess The Hot Actress?!
description:
Chix On Netflix!
                          Can You Guess
                          The Hot Actres
body:
Chix On Netflix!

title: Surgeon to Be Extradited to Ohio For Allegedly Murdering Ex-Wife, Husband
description:
Ohio Double Murder Suspect
                          Ship Me To Columbus ...
body:
Ohio Double Murder Suspect
                          Ship Me To Columbus ...
                          I'm Innocent!!!
                      
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    WIFR
          
    
          Michael McKee, the Illinois surgeon charged with murdering his ex-wife and her husband inside their Ohio home, agreed to be shipped back to Ohio to face murder charges ... but he says he's innocent.
      
    
          McKee appeared in court Monday after his Saturday arrest in Illinois and waived extradition back to Ohio, where he is accused of gunning down Spencer and Monique Tepe in the early hours of Dec. 30 with the couple's two young children in the home.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Check out this footage from inside an Illinois court room ... McKee is shackled and wearing a mustard prison jumpsuit. The only time he speaks is when he states his full name.
      

          McKee has a public defender, and his lawyer said he intends to plead not guilty.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          As we reported ... cops say they traced a car seen near the home around the time of the murders back to McKee in Illinois, where he worked as a vascular surgeon.
      
    
          He was married to Monique for a couple years before they divorced in 2017 ... she married Spencer in 2020 and they had two kids, who were unharmed in the shooting in suburban Columbus, Ohio.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          The kids are now staying with family members.
      
      
              
          
                          
                Crime & Arrests
              
                          
                Viral
              
                          
                Fairly Legal

schema.headline: Surgeon to Be Extradited to Ohio For Allegedly Murdering Ex-Wife, Husband

title: 'Home Alone' Star Daniel Stern Charged With Soliciting Prostitution
description:
'Home Alone' Star Daniel Stern
                          Being Prosecuted Over Prostitution Bust
body:
'Home Alone' Star Daniel Stern
                          Being Prosecuted Over Prostitution Bust
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              January 12, 2026
                            4:57 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          "Home Alone" star Daniel Stern has just been hit with a criminal charge in California for allegedly trying to hire a hooker.
      
    
          A rep for the Ventura County District Attorney tells TMZ ... prosecutors just charged the actor with soliciting prostitution.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          We're told Daniel's arraignment is set for Tuesday morning ... but it sounds like prosecutors aren't expecting him to be there. Instead, we're told Daniel's attorney could appear for him.
      

          TMZ broke the story ... Daniel was issued a citation last month for allegedly trying to hire an escort at a hotel in Camarillo, CA.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Daniel wasn't arrested at the time, only given a ticket, but now he's getting the book thrown at him.
      
    
          A rep for the Ventura County DA's Office told us the case was submitted to them late Friday by the Ventura County Sheriff's Office ... so it didn't take long for prosecutors to decide to formally file criminal charges against Daniel.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          We reached out to Daniel's camp ... so far, no word back.
